headline: EMR Q2 Deep Dive: Automation Demand Steady, Margin Expansion Faces Tariff and FX Headwinds
summary: Engineering and automation solutions company Emerson (NYSE:EMR) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025 as sales rose 3.9% year on year to $4.55 billion. On the other hand, the company expects next quarter’s revenue to be around $4.90 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.52 per share was 0.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
